  粉末酒精通常与传统液体醇消费相关的健康风险，尽管其对消费效力的差异有一些差异，但储存，隐藏性和便携性，缺乏熟悉程度的特征差异，尚无熟悉程度新型递送方法。过量的酒精消耗可能导致急性过量，中毒相关的意外损伤，受损的判断和长期负面健康后果，包括肝病，癌症和生理依赖性。 [17]

 粉末酒精的可用性可能会对零售商产生负面影响＆＃39;经济利益随着客户可能通过在其他地方购买更便宜的粉末醇混合物来增加其购买的液体酒精饮料，从而可以从这些企业那里购买更少的相对昂贵和更安全的酒精。
 客户使用粉末酒精可以增加这些企业的责任＆＃39;通过提高监测客户的准确性和能力＆＃39;酒精消费 - 他们在法律上旨在通过陶醉或欠龄客户来预防饮酒。这可能会使他们持巨大责任在民事责任诉讼的关注（因为零售商对不应该送达酒精的顾客造成的酒精归属伤害负责）。
     用于胶囊的辅助材料可以是任何易水溶性物质（例如碳水化合物，例如葡萄糖（淀粉水解产物），蛋白如明胶）。对于粉末醇，选择麦芽糖糊精（一种糊精）。
  在该方法中，对糊精和醇的混合物进行同时喷涂和加热。喷雾剂将液体转化为小滴（直径最多几百μm（微米）），并且热量导致含水糊精形成薄膜。当薄膜干燥时，下降成为含有醇和糊精的微胶囊。
 在干燥之前和之后，比较水和醇的量，除去约90％的水，损失约10％的乙醇。 [15]考虑的原因之一是以下。
 在诸如此类的混合物中，分子运动的速度取决于分子尺寸和碳水化合物（在这种情况下，麦芽糖糊精）浓度。水是混合物中最小的分子，能够移动和蒸发最快。通过较高浓度，通过降低水，水分子可以快速移动。在形成的膜之后，对较大的分子比水更少渗透。当胶片完成时，水已经足够蒸发。这种现象称为＃34;选择性扩散。＆＃34; [20] 
通常，在喷射后，从过程开始时，每滴的封装在约0.1秒内完成。在每滴或胶囊中没有时间进行内部对流。 [15]
 最终，已经生产了大量的微胶囊。这些成为称为粉末醇或醇粉末的粉末状物质。根据佐藤＆＃39; S网页，粉末醇在粉末状态下含有30.5％的乙醇体积。 [10]
 除了干燥前的混合物外，如果需要，可以加入其他添加剂（例如提取物，甜味剂，香料，着色物等）。
 结果，可以据说酒精粉是饮用的饮料，即＆＃34;干燥＆＃34;。例如，A＆＃34;干马蒂尼鸡尾酒＆＃34;由醇粉制成的可以称为A＆＃34;干燥干马蒂尼鸡尾酒＆＃34;或＆＃34;干燥干马蒂尼鸡尾酒＆＃34; [11]
   通常，在考虑粉末产品如咖啡的质量时，冷冻干燥似乎比喷雾干燥更好，但这不适用于酒精粉末生产。事实上，＆＃34;冻干啤酒香料＆＃34;是由大学生为他们的研究制作的。二氧化碳，水和酒精都丢失了。 [22]
 由于醇的挥发性，不应使用比水的挥发性，耗时的方法，例如冷冻干燥。通过选择性扩散，含酒的损失相对较小。

   日本酒税法案（JA：酒税法）修订1981年4月[36] [26]将粉末醇作为酒精饮料进行分类。在粉末醇的生产中，添加一些非酒精成分，其类似于一些利口酒。尽管如此，粉末醇成为一类单独的酒精饮料。
 1981年5月，佐藤收到了商业上生产酒精粉的第一个许可。在日本，粉末酒精是正式称为Funmatsu-Shu（JA：粉末粉末，Lit.＆＃39;糖粉饮料＆＃39;）。 [3]粉末醇由法律定义为＆＃34;可以溶解的粉状物质，并且可以使含有1％或更多醇的饮料由体积＆＃34; [37]

产品＆＃39; S创作者和营销人员 - 威尔士·瓦（Martyn Van Nierop）的伤害vancerop等波隆职业学院的武器职业研究所 - 声称瞄准青年市场。他们将饮料与Bacardi Breezer这样的饮料进行比较，并表示他们预计相对较低的酒精内容将受到年轻段的欢迎。
 由于荷兰法律的复杂性，像Booz2go这样的粉末酒不能受到酒精和Horeca代码的影响，因为它不是含酒精的饮料。这意味着任何年龄的人都可以合法地购买。然而，当达到水中的溶解在水中时，据荷兰国家荷兰国家酒精预防基金会的主任Wim Van Dalen表示，它将受代码。 von dalen评论说，虽然他一般不支持新的酒精饮料，但他怀疑粉末会变得有吸引力。卫生部，福利和运动部的发言人表示，他们不会对该产品进行任何行动，而是补充说，根据其他法律，该标签必须遏制消费者对消费者的任何健康风险的警告。 [39]
    根据一家俄罗斯新闻网站，在2009年，圣彼得堡技术大学教授名为Yevgeny Moskalev发明和专利了一种创造酒精粉的方法。该方法可以使来自任何种类的酒精饮料的酒精粉。 [41]
  该方法在96％的Spirit Vodka上进行了测试。在该方法中，搅拌熔化的蜡（硬脂酸），倒入醇饮料。溶液散热并变成含有醇和蜡的滴。凝固的液滴构成酒精粉。

Jump to navigation  Jump to search  Alcohol powder or  powdered alcohol or  dry alcohol is a product generally made using  micro-encapsulation. When reconstituted with water,  alcohol (specifically ethanol) in powder form becomes an  alcoholic drink. In March 2015 four product labels for specific powdered alcohol products were approved by the United States Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau (TTB) which opened the doors for legal product sales. However, as of 4 January 2016, the product is not yet available for sale and legalization remains controversial due to public-health and other concerns.  [1] Researchers have expressed concern that, should the product go into production, increases in alcohol misuse, abuse, and associated physical harm to its consumers could occur above what has been historically associated with liquid alcohol alone.
    In 1966  ( ) Sato Foods Industries Co., Ltd. invented alcohol pulverization. Sato is a food additives and seasoning manufacturer in  Aichi Pref., Japan. ( ja:佐藤食品工業 (愛知県))   [3] A year later, in 1967, Sato began production and sales of various kinds of "high content alcohol powder  Alcock" ("高含度アルコール粉末「 アルコック」").  [3]
 On 15 January 1974, a practical manufacturing process for alcohol powder was patented by Sato.  [4]  [5]  [6]  [7] Sato has  patented the process in 17 countries around the world.  [8]  [9]  [10]
 In the 1970s Sato began promoting powdered alcohol in the United States. Test sales began in 1977 under the trade name "SureShot".  [11]  [12] The product "Palcohol" was announced for future release in the U.S. in 2015.
  Officially, Sato says that its products are for business use only, for example for the use of food-processing industries or food-and-drink businesses (e.g. restaurant, café,  sweets shop,  bakery shop, etc.). Mainly, its products are to be used as food additives. Other than purposes for test sale, research, etc., it has never been sold for eating or drinking, including personal use or home use.  [9]  [13]
 In June 1982, Sato started production and sales for the drinking powdered alcohol, as test case. Its name is "powdered cocktail  Alcock-Light cocktail" ("粉末カクテル   'アルコック・ライトカクテル' ").  [3]  [14] At least, during some years, it seems that had continued to test sales.  [15]  [16]
  Powdered alcohol would generally share the health risks that are associated with traditional liquid alcohol consumption, although there may be some differences in its effects related to differences in consumption potency, differences in characteristics for storage, concealability, and portability, lack of familiarity, and potentially novel delivery methods. Excessive consumption of alcohol can result in acute overdose, intoxication-related accidental injury, compromised judgment, and longer-term negative health consequences including liver disease, cancer, and physiologic dependence.  [17]
  As with the public health concerns, the following concerns have been posed but data are not yet available to prove or disprove them. Because of the unique characteristics of powdered alcohol, introduction in the U.S. could raise significant concerns from alcohol retailers as it will raise the awareness of their customers health and well as a major priority. including such as restaurants, bars, and sporting venues,  [18] including:
 Availability of powdered alcohol could negatively affect retailers' economic interests as customers might now have the ability to purchase less relatively expensive and safer alcohol from those businesses by augmenting their purchased liquid alcohol drinks with cheaper powdered alcohol mixtures purchased elsewhere.
 Use of powdered alcohol by customers could increase responsibility of these businesses' by increasing the accuracy and abilities to monitor their customers' alcohol consumption - which they are legally required to do to try to prevent the consumption of alcohol by intoxicated or under-age customers. This could hold them at a greater responsibility out of concern of civil-liability lawsuits (because retailers are held liable for alcohol-attributable harms caused by customers who should not have been served alcohol).
     An auxiliary material for a capsule may be any readily water-soluble substance (e.g.  carbohydrate such as  dextrins ( starch  hydrolyzate),  protein such as  gelatin). For powdered alcohol,  maltodextrin (a type of dextrin) was chosen.
  In this process, a  mixture of dextrin and alcohol is subjected to simultaneous spraying and heating. The spraying converts the liquid to small drops (up to several hundred  μm (micrometers) in diameter), and the heat causes the hydrous dextrin to form a film. When the film dries, the drop becomes a microcapsule containing alcohol and dextrin.
 Before and after drying, comparing the amounts of water and alcohol, about 90% of water is removed and about 10% of ethyl alcohol is lost.  [15] One of the reasons which are considered, is the following.
 In mixtures such as this, the speed of molecule movement is dependent on molecule size and  carbohydrate (in this case, maltodextrin) concentration. Water, the smallest molecule in the mixture, is able to move and evaporate fastest. In higher concentration, by decreasing water, water molecules can move much faster. After the film formed it is less permeable to larger molecules than water. By the time the film is completed, water has evaporated enough. This phenomenon is called " selective diffusion."  [20]
 In general, after sprayed, encapsulation for each drop is completed within about 0.1 second from the very beginning of the process. There is no time for the internal convection in each drop or capsule to occur.  [15]
 Ultimately, large amounts of microcapsules have been produced. These become the powdery matter called powdered alcohol or alcohol powder. According to Sato's web page, powdered alcohol contains 30.5% ethyl alcohol by volume in the state of powder.  [10]
 In addition to the mixture before drying, if necessary, other additives (e.g. extract, sweetener, spices, coloring matter, etc.) may be added.
 As a result, alcohol powder can be said to be an alcoholic beverage that is " dry".For example, a "dry  martini" made from alcohol powder may be referred to as a " dry dry martini" or " dried dry martini".  [11]
   Typically, when considering the quality of a powdered product such as  coffee,  freeze drying seems to be better than spray drying, but this does not apply to alcohol powder production. In fact, " freeze-dried beer spice" was made by university students for their research.  Carbon dioxide, water and alcohol have all been lost.  [22]
 Due to the  volatility of alcohol, relatively higher than water, time-consuming methods, such as freeze drying, should not be used. By selective diffusion, loss of alcohol is relatively small.
  In 2014, an article on the website PopSci.com published instructions on how to make pulverized alcohol easily, through a simple mixture of alcohol and dextrin.  [23]
 In this method, the powder is not encapsulated, and also not yet fully dried. Consequently, alcohol continues to evaporate from it very rapidly.
 Due to flaws in the powdered alcohol produced by this method, this form of powdered alcohol was said to be unsuitable for drinking, carrying, or preserving.
 Any production of powdered alcohol without a license is illegal in Japan, even if it is only for personal use, according to the Liquor Tax Act of Japan.
   Currently, the alcoholic beverage industry in Japan is large and powerful. [   citation needed] [   opinion] For example, in fiscal year 2013,  Suntory, one of the country's largest beverage companies, recorded sales of 570.7 billion  yen (about US$4.7 billion) in alcoholic beverages, excluding wine  [24] Currently, the sales revenue from powdered alcohol has been too small to affect the sales of liquid-alcohol companies. Additionally, powdered alcohol's market share is currently too small to be considered as a statistical item in Japanese tax reports.  [25]
 Powdered alcohol is found in some mass production foods, used in small amounts (as are other additives).
  In 1977, the  Associated Press delivered the first news story in the United States about powdered alcohol, which was then an unprecedented product. Investors were quoted as saying that they "hope[d] to revolutionize the liquor business with a product that's easy to carry, cheap and potent". A test sale of powdered alcohol, called "SureShot", was done in the United States.  [11]  [12]  [26]
  According to  food chemist Udo Pollmer of the European Institute of Food and Nutrition Sciences in  Munich, alcohol can be absorbed in  cyclodextrins, a synthetic carbohydrate  derivative. In this way, encapsuled in small capsules, the fluid can be handled as a powder. The cyclodextrins can absorb an estimated 60 percent of their own weight in alcohol.  [27] A US  patent was registered for the process as early as 1974.  [28]
   Nebulizer: Alcohol powder produced through molecular encapsulation with  cyclodextrin can be used with a  nebulizer  [30] though this could be dangerous.
    Powdered alcohol is illegal in the state of  Victoria, as of 1 July 2015.  [31] As of the Liquor (Undesirable Liquor Product - Powdered Alcohol) Amendment Regulation 2018, made under the Liquor Act 1992, Powdered Alcohol in Queensland was banned and pronounced illegal.  [32] The NSW Government also recognises powdered alcohol an undesirable product under the Liquor Regulation Act 2018.  [33]
   The product was available in four flavors and packed in 65-gram, or possibly 100-gram, sachets. When mixed with 0.25 liters of water, it created a drink with 4.8% alcohol. It was assumed that a German producer manufactured the  alcopop powder based on imported raw alcohol powder from the U.S.  [34]
   The Japanese Liquor Tax Act ( ja:酒税法) amendment of April 1981  [36]  [26] classifies powdered alcohol as an alcoholic beverage. In the production of powdered alcohol some non-alcoholic ingredients are added which is similar to some liqueurs. Nonetheless, powdered alcohol became a separate category of alcoholic beverages.
 In May 1981, Sato received the first license to produce alcohol powder commercially. In Japan, powdered alcohol is officially called,  funmatsu-shu  (  ja:粉末酒, lit. 'powdered-alcoholic beverage').  [3]Powdered alcohol is defined by law as a "powdery substance that can be dissolved, and can make a beverage containing 1% or more alcohol by volume".  [37]
 Before the 1981 amendment, powdered alcohol was outside the scope of Liquor Tax, as it is not a liquid.  [14]
  In 2007, four food technology students in the  Netherlands invented a powdered alcohol product called "Booz2go".  [38] They claimed that when mixed with water, the powder would produce a bubbly, lime-colored and  lime-flavored drink, with 3% alcohol. When put into commercial production, it was expected to sell for €1.50 (approx.  US$1.60) for a 20 gram sachet.
 The product's creators and marketers – Harm van Elderen, Martyn van Nierop, and others at Helicon Vocational Institute in  Boxtel – claimed to be aiming at the youth market. They compared the drink to alcopops like  Bacardi Breezer and said they expected the relatively low alcohol content would be popular with the young segment.
 Because of complexities in Dutch laws, powdered alcohol like Booz2Go would not be subject to the Alcohol and  Horeca Code, because it is not literally an alcoholic drink. This means that anybody of any age could buy it legally. However, when dissolved in water, it would be subject to the Code, according to Director Wim van Dalen of the Dutch National Foundation for Alcohol Prevention. Von Dalen commented that while he generally did not support new alcoholic drinks, he doubted the powder would become attractive. A spokesman of the  Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport said they would not undertake any actions against the product, but added that the label would have to contain a warning about any health risks for the consumer, in accordance with other laws.  [39]
    According to one Russian news site, in 2009, a Professor at  Saint Petersburg Technological University named Yevgeny Moskalev invented and patented a method of creating alcohol powder. This method could make alcohol powder from any kind of alcoholic beverage.  [41]
  The method was tested on 96% spirit vodka. In this method, melted wax ( stearic acid) is stirred, and the alcoholic drink is poured in. The solution dissipates and becomes drops containing alcohol and wax. The drops that solidify constitute alcohol powder.
 It was proposed that Moskalev's powdered alcohol could be wrapped in paper and carried around in a pocket or a bag. In addition, a pill form, containing alcohol, was also made with this method.
 Professor Moskalev responded: "powdered vodka tastes like a candle"; "I did not like vodka in pills"; and, in conclusion, "vodka is best consumed the old way".
  In 2008, Pulver Spirits began developing a line of alcohol powder products to be marketed in the United States. The marketing was reportedly intended to be in full compliance with alcohol regulations and targeted at adults of legal drinking age.  [42]
 In Spring 2014, the Arizona-based company Lipsmark LLC announced that it would start marketing powdered alcohol under the name "Palcohol", a  portmanteau of  powder +  alcohol.  [43] This caused considerable controversy, after the product was approved by the TTB for sale. This approval was later attributed to a "labeling error", and the manufacturer surrendered the approvals.  [44]
 In March, 2015, the U.S. Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau (TTB) approved four powdered alcohol products with the brand name "Palcohol" for sale in the U.S.  [45] Under the  Twenty-first Amendment to the United States Constitution, state and territory governments also have substantial regulatory powers over "intoxicating liquors", especially regarding retail sales and sales to minors.  [46] Shortly after the TTB approval was announced, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) responded to inaccurate reports implying that it had approved powdered alcohol as being safe. The FDA clarified that its role was to evaluate the nonalcoholic ingredients and that based on its evaluation of specific powdered alcohol products it had no legal basis to block their entry into the U.S. market.  [47]
 In 2014, Ohio state legislators introduced legislation that would ban Palcohol and all other powdered alcohol.  [48] The following year, Iowa state legislators followed suit.  [49]
  On 25 March 2015, alcohol wholesalers and distributors in the state of Maryland announced an agreement to voluntarily ban the distribution and sale of powdered alcohol.  [51] Concerns included the potential for abuse by minors, the ease of using the powder to bring alcohol into public events or to  spike drinks, and the potential to  snort the powder. At the same time, a bill to ban Palcohol for one year was under consideration in the Maryland House of Delegates.
  By November 2015, most states had introduced legislation and laws to regulate or ban powdered alcohol. Twenty-seven have banned powdered alcohol, 2 more have placed temporary 1-year bans on the product and 3 have included powdered alcohol under their statutory definitions of alcohol meaning that it is covered by existing alcohol regulations.  [53] [   needs update]
  The legal status of powdered alcohol in United Kingdom is uncertain, although parliament saw no dangers from the sale of powdered alcohol, aside from the loss of tax revenue.  [54] In a January 2015 answer to a  parliamentary question,  Lord Bates wrote "The Government is aware of powdered alcohol from media reports and the banning of the product in five states of the United States of America. The Government is aware of powdered alcohol being marketed and made available in the coming years to buy in England and  Wales."  [55]

帮助使良好的加强喜剧的规则令人惊讶地帮助制造好产品。让＆＃39;在两者之间贯穿有趣的相似之处，以及如何将一些课程应用于完善以构建更好的产品。
 EAGHT Comedy是一种剧院，表演者根据观众的提示创建未计算的场景。我一直在做改进3年，我经常抓住自己认为改进的框架很好地适用于产品。
   任何改进场景中的基本现实是＆＃34;谁，什么，＆＃34;舞台上的角色。例如，一个基础现实可能是两个朋友（谁）在公园（在哪里）。当你＆＃39;在你身上盯着你的舞台上，有一个自然的匆忙，但我们需要抗拒。基本现实需要首先奠定它，它不需要搞笑。它需要清除，并成为中性背景，以便对抗鲜明的事情。
 关键产品课程是您应该了解您在做其他任何事物之前的世界。这是您产品的基本现实。谁是你的客户？他们的问题是什么？他们对这些问题有什么关系？现有解决方案的哪一部分您不会改变？抵制自然抢购与功能，设计，工程 - 以及首次观察和理解您的基础现实。基本现实应该是创新的，你应该小心与你想要的东西。具体和真实。以下是基础现实的一些例子。
   一旦建立了一个基础现实，即兴表演者就会寻找游戏。这是脱颖而出的不寻常的东西，一切有趣的一切都围绕着。它对改进者明确框架（具有震惊的反应，困惑的问题，戏剧性暂停等）非常重要，所以每个人（包括观众）都了解什么＆＃39; s异常。
 在这个草图中，线条＆＃34;今天有没有女人吗？＆＃34;明确框架不寻常的事情。确实有女人穿着男人。
 它同样非常重要，您暂停并明确了解您的产品游戏。清楚并作为一个关于您不寻常的见解和信仰的团队对齐。这些可能是您最关键的假设，并形成您的创新的基础。您的洞察力可能是一个具体的问题，技术方法，分布，空间的趋势等。这里＆＃39;重新执行一些例子。 
在那里有一种自然倾向，提升了许多游戏，因为我们＆＃39;害怕不够好笑。然而，最有趣的场景很有趣，而不是因为他们有多个游戏，而是因为他们采取了一个专注的游戏，以便在没有人（即使是表演者）期望。即兴创始人通过探索游戏（＆＃34;如果这是真的，为什么是真实的？＆＃34;）或提高它（＆＃34;如果这是真的，还有什么是真的？＆＃34; ）。
 在这个草图中，游戏是恒定的分歧，它＆＃39;它。其他一切都是完全正常的。
 这也是产品的重要课程。抵制诱惑带来大量游戏，因为你想对冲你的赌注，或者因为它看起来都很令人兴奋。少做，并拿走它没有人（包括你）可以期待。奇迹＆＃34;为什么＆＃34;从第一个原则探索您的主要见解和理由背后的更深层次的理由。奇迹＆＃34;还有什么＆＃34;通过推导第二（和N）订单影响和外围创意来提高您的关键见解。
  一些简介场景由通用线路和表演者有机提取游戏。例如＆＃34;我可以相信它＆＃39;午夜＆＃34;是一个有趣的开始于场景，但是没有明显的游戏。相比之下，一些改进场景是立即使用强烈游戏启动的。例如用＆＃34发起场景;没有，你＆＃39;重新参加会计师，你可以＆＃39; t只是成为狮子驯服和＃34;两种方式都可以带来搞笑场景。
 同样，一些产品被引发了一个粗略的想法。这是在Eric Reis＆＃39的营地;模型，你在哪里＆＃39;重新倾斜，获得反馈，快速迭代。这个想法是将产品市场的道路视为与假设的一系列实验。相比之下，Keith Rabois＆＃39;模型，您在第0天有一个强烈的愿景，从那时起并没有太大的变化。这个想法是你从一开始就拥有一个大师计划，你会在执行它的时候开始。通过Casey Winters查看此帖子，比较这些模型，更细微的细节。
 当然，理想情况下，您应该尽快找到您的产品游戏，以留下更多空间来探索或提高。但是，你应该在第0天开始使用不知道你的游戏作为借口而不是开始。您今天应该开始构建您的基础现实，看看有什么曲面。 Opendoor成功地拥有强大的初始前提，但闲暇和分部会随着时间的推移发现了他们的游戏。
  有一些东西可以从改进中学到构建更好的产品。当然，即使没有改进类比，也可以推断和沟通这些见解。但是，我认为在横向工艺中看到奇怪的连接为洞察力创造了更深入的欣赏。加上，它的乐趣在你喜欢的两件事上盯着你所爱的两件事。希望你发现这些比较是有趣的，希望你有一些产品和改进的笑声。
note_en:
The rules that help make good improv comedy can surprisingly help make good product too. Let's run through interesting parallels between the two, and how you can apply some lessons from improv to build better product.
 Improv comedy is a kind of theatre where performers create unscripted scenes based on prompts from the audience. I've been doing improv for 3 years and I often catch myself thinking that the framework used in improv applies to product pretty well.
   The base reality in any improv scene is the "who, what, where" of the characters on stage. For example, a base reality could be two friends (who) having lunch (what) in a park (where). When you're on stage with eyes peered on you, there's a natural  rush to be funny but we need to resist. The base reality needs to be laid first and in fact, it doesn't need to be funny. It needs to be clear and serve as a neutral background for the funny things to contrast against.
 The key product lesson is that you should understand the world you are in before you do anything else. This is the base reality of your product. Who are your customers? What are their problems? What do they do about these problems? What part of the existing solutions will you  not change? Resist the natural  rush to be creative with features, designs, engineering  - and first observe and understand your base reality. The base reality  shouldn't be innovative and you should be careful about contriving it to be what you wish. Be specific and truthful. Here are some examples of base realities.
   Once a base reality is established, improv performers look to find  the game. This is the  unusual thing that stands out, and everything funny revolves around. It's really important for improvisers to explicitly  frame the game (with a shocked reaction, a confused question, a dramatic pause and so on) so everyone (including the audience) understands what's unusual.
 In this sketch, the line "Are there any women here today?" explicitly frames the unusual thing. There are indeed women dressed as men.
 It's similarly really important that you pause and get explicit about your product  game. Be clear and aligned as a team about your unusual insights and beliefs. These will likely be your most critical assumptions and form the basis of your innovation. Your insight could be a specific take on the problem, the technical approach, the distribution, the trends in the space, and so on. Here're some examples.
   There's a natural tendency in improv to bring in  lots of  games because we're afraid about  not being funny enough. However, the funniest scenes are funny not because they have multiple games, but because they take a focused game to places no one (even the performers) expects. Improvisors do just that by exploring the game ("if this is true, why is it true?") or heightening it ("if this is true, what else is true?").
 In this sketch, the game is constant disagreement, and that's it. Everything else is totally normal.
 This is an important lesson with product too. Resist the temptation to bring in  lots of games because you want to  hedge your bets or because  it all looks exciting. Do less, and take it places no one (including you) can expect. Wonder "why" to explore the deeper rationale behind your key insights and reason from first principles. Wonder "what else" to heighten your key insights by deducing second (and n) order impact and peripheral ideas.
  Some improv scenes are initiated with a generic line and performers extract the game organically. e.g. "I can't believe it's midnight" is an intriguing start to a scene but there's no obvious game. In contrast, some improv scenes are initiated with strong game right away. e.g. initiating the scene with "No, you're an accountant, you can't just become a lion tamer". Both ways can lead to hilarious scenes.
 Likewise, some products are initiated with a rough idea. This is in the camp of  Eric Reis' model, where you're lean, get feedback, and iterate quickly. The idea is to treat the path to product market fit as a series of experiments with hypotheses. In contrast, there is  Keith Rabois' model, where you have a strong vision from day 0 and not much changes from then. The idea is that you have a master plan from the start, and you get heads down on executing it. Check this  post by Casey Winters comparing these models with far more nuance.
 Of course, ideally you should find your product game  as soon as possible to leave more room to explore or heighten. However, you shouldn't use not knowing your game from day 0 as an excuse to to not get started. You should start building your base reality  today and see what surfaces. OpenDoor succeeded with strong initial premise, but Slack and Segment discovered their game over time.
  There are a few things we can learn from improv to build better product. Of course, these insights could be deduced and communicated even  without the improv analogy. However, I think seeing strange connections in lateral crafts creates a much deeper appreciation for the insights. Plus, it's fun to geek out on two things you love, at the same time. Hope you found these comparisons as amusing as I did, and hope you have a few laughs with product and improv.
title: 您的产品是一个笑话：来自改进的课程，构建更好的产品
title_en: Your product is a joke: lessons from improv to build better product

note: 谷歌希望看到Linux内核中的Rust编程语言支持，因此他们已经合同了＆＃34的铅开发人员; Linux＆＃34 Rust;随着工作的旨在获得主题。   谷歌今天将在Linux内核中的Rust上市，以提高内存安全，并且他们已经合同开发人员Miguel Ojeda，以进一步为Linux内核和相关安全工作的rust工作。本合同至少在明年经历。   除了吸引新的开发人员并在内核中开放新的门，谷歌与谷歌与这款公共支持和米格尔＆＃39;合同的主要动机是在提高内核的记忆安全范围内集中。   这个新闻虽然真的应该是令人惊讶的。在内核中RFC补丁系列进行RFC贴片系列，谷歌确实在今年早些时候开始对其支持的支持开始，允许核心Android开发生锈。   谷歌应该有一个博客文章，不久宣布他们最新支持Linux内核。
note_en: Google wants to see Rust programming language support within the Linux kernel so much so that they have contracted the lead developer working on "Rust for Linux" as the work aims to get mainlined.   Google is going public today with their formal support for Rust in the Linux kernel to enhance memory safety and that they have contracted developer Miguel Ojeda to further his work on Rust for the Linux kernel and related security efforts. This contract is going through at least the next year.   Besides attracting new developers and opening up new doors with Rust in the kernel, Google's primary motivation with this public support and Miguel's contract is centered around improving memory safety of the kernel.   This news though really shouldn't be surprising. Following  the RFC patch series for Rust in the kernel, Google  did voice their support back then and earlier this year  began allowing Rust for core Android development.   Google should have out a blog post shortly announcing their latest support around Rust for the Linux kernel.
title: Google希望在Linux内核中生锈
title_en: Google Wants Rust in the Linux Kernel

note:
我们是在IRC网络世界开始的数学和计算博士俱乐部。我们计划从数学和计算领域挑选经典，并将它们读在一起。我们选择阅读的书籍和文学略有偏差，因此俱乐部的名称！我们的重点是在挑选概念和技术的阅读材料上，长期以来一直存在，并且周围的绝缘空气。
  特别是，我们不会在大多数时候追逐技术的最新趋势。但我们也不是雷通俱乐部。例如，我们可能不会谈论加剧64上的基本编程。我们为我们的俱乐部会议选择的主题很大程度上将成为数学和计算领域仍然非常相关和重要的主题，但它们可能不是被认为是主流的。例如，我们将阅读像分析数字理论介绍的书籍或谈论常见的LISP编程。有时，这些主题可能与现代趋势或恢复相交，但大部分时间都不会。这是我们想要击中的那种甜蜜点。
    这是关于我们社区的一点历史。当我在##算法上宣布时，这个社区出生在Freenode IRC网络上，在那里，我将在那里托管图书俱乐部会议上的分析数字理论。我创建了一个名叫#susam的临时频道，讨论书俱乐部活动并计划会议日程表。一些成员加入了这个频道，并形成了书俱乐部。
  我们的第一次会议于2021年3月4日通过IRC发生。我们意识到通过音频与共享桌面会话讨论数学会更有效，我们可以使用一些软件工具来涂抹并渲染使用乳胶的数学公式。所以第二天，即在2021年3月5日，我们通过缩放进行了我们的第一个网络会议。后来，在黑客新闻公告之后，一些来自黑客新闻社区的成员也加入了我们的俱乐部，而且社区的结果稍微生长了一点。
  在该俱乐部最初日期的网络会议期间，我攻击了一个小型非WSIIWYG工具，帮助快速打字乳胶代码，并使用MathJax在窗格上呈现。这帮助我们快速涂鸦数学，同时了解我们在书中遇到的概念。该工具继续与我们的书俱乐部发展，并很快被释放为莫比达。我们经常在会议期间使用它。
    我们以后搬到了利比拉IRC，并继续运营临时渠道。自从我们开始这些会议以来，它现在已经超过3个月了。虽然我们的社区很小，但会议一直在进行中，我们在分析数字理论领域学习了许多新的和有趣的概念和定理。经过3个月的成功会议，今天，即在2021年6月15日，我决定为我们的社区创造一个更加常设的地方，以一个代表我们社区的名字。这个新社区现在被称为offbeat计算俱乐部。我相信这个新名称代表了我们社区和我们的会议的性质。
  在这个社区中，我们从数学和计算领域选择经典并将它们读在一起。我们现在在利维拉IRC上的#offBeat频道。 
自该俱乐部开始以来，我们在分析数字理论的研究中取得了良好的进展。 这一主题的会议一直在进行中。 我现在有一点空闲时间，所以我可以在其他主题上添加一些并行会议。 Emacs和Lisp位于我的脑海顶部。 我将计划一些东西并尽快发出更新。 与此同时，如果任何社区成员有兴趣举办自己的书俱乐部会议，我们也将向他们添加到我们的日程安排。  加入我们的频道#Fuara聊天聊天，成为我们俱乐部活动的一部分。 或者，您还可以通过它的矩阵桥在#offbeat：libera.chat中加入我们的频道。 通道链路和桥接链路指向同一通道，因此您需要只加入其中一个，而不是两个。 如果您不是活动的IRC用户，则更倾向于加入矩阵桥，因为它更方便地对IRC不熟悉的人。 到时候那里见！
note_en:
We are a mathematics and computation book club that began in the world of IRC networks. We plan to pick classics from the field of mathematics and computation, and read them together. The books and literature we pick for reading are of slightly offbeat nature, hence the name of this club! Our focus is on picking reading material about concepts and technologies that have been around for a long time and have an air of timelessness around them.
  In particular, we will not be chasing the latest trends in technology most of the time. But we are not a retrocomputing club either. For example, we are likely not going to talk about BASIC programming on Commodore 64. The topics we pick for our club meetings are largely going to be topics that are still quite relevant and important in the field of mathematics and computation but they may not be what is considered to be mainstream. For example, we will read books like  Introduction to Analytic Number Theory or talk about Common Lisp programming. Sometimes these topics may intersect with modern trends or retrocomputing but most of the times they would not. That is the kind of sweet spot we want to hit.
    Here is a little bit of history about our community. This community was born on the Freenode IRC network when I announced on the  ##algorithms and  ##math channels there that I would be hosting book club meetings on analytic number theory. I created a makeshift channel named  #susam to discuss the book club activities and plan the meeting schedule. Several members joined this channel and the book club was formed.
  Our first meeting occurred via IRC on 4 Mar 2021. We realized that it would be much more efficient to discuss mathematics via audio along with a shared desktop session where we can use some software tool to scribble out and render mathematics formulas using LaTeX. So on the next day, that is, on 5 Mar 2021, we had our first web meeting via Zoom. Later, after  an announcement on Hacker News, some members from the Hacker News community joined our club too and the community grew a little bit more as a result.
  During the web meetings in the initial days of this club, I hacked up a tiny non-WSYIWYG tool that helped in typing out LaTeX code quickly and have it rendered on a pane using MathJax. This helped us to scribble mathematics quickly while understanding the concepts we came across in the book. This tool continued to evolve with our book club and it was soon released as  Muboard. We use it often during our meetings.
    We moved to Libera IRC later and continued to operate out of a makeshift channel. It has now been more than 3 months since we began these meetings. Although our community is tiny, the meetings have been going on consistently and we have learnt numerous new and interesting concepts and theorems in the field of analytic number theory. After 3 months of successful meetings, today, that is, on 15 Jun 2021, I decided to create a more permanent place for our community with a name that represents our community better. This new community is now called the  Offbeat Computation Club. I believe this new name represents the nature of our community and our meetings.
  In this community, we pick classics from the field of mathematics and computation and read them together. We are now operating out of the  #offbeat channel on Libera IRC.
    Since this club began, we have made good progress with the study of analytic number theory. The meetings for this topic have been going on consistencly. I have a little more free time now, so I can add a few more parallel meetings on other topics. Emacs and Lisp are on the top of my mind. I will plan something out and post an update soon. In the meantime, if any community member is interested to host their own book club meetings, we will have them added too to our schedule.
    Join our channel  #offbeat on Libera Chat and be a part of our club activities. Alternatively, you can also join our channel via its Matrix bridge at  #offbeat:libera.chat. Both the channel link and the bridge link point to the same channel, so you need to join only one of them, not both. If you are not an active IRC user, prefer joining the Matrix bridge because it is more convenient for someone unfamiliar with IRC. See you there!
title: 你好，世界！ 欢迎来到offbeat计算俱乐部！
title_en: Hello, World! Welcome to the Offbeat Computation Club!

克利夫兰＆＃39; Splash Financial是一家专门从事学生贷款再融资的数字贷款平台，宣布收盘为4430万系列B资金圆形，这将有助于进一步加速其稳定增长。
 这一轮风险投资于2020年5月在一轮一轮赛中持续了1230万美元。自2013年成立以来，金融公司已筹集了超过6000万美元的股权资金。飞溅以前被称为毕业的冰球，直至2016年重塑成本。
 该公司表示，B系列由DST全球，花旗企业，底特律风险伙伴和Firebolt Ventures的合作伙伴领导，以及现有的投资者CMFG Ventures和西北互向的企业。
 Splash创始人兼首席执行官Steven Muszynski表示，这项投资将有助于扩展平台＆＃39; S贷款网络和自动承保平台。两者都是业务的关键支柱，它具有混合市场模型，即在寻求再融资贷款时，用户可以购买并比较利率。
 ＆＃34;我认为这表明我们的投资者在我们＆＃39的信心中表现出了我们在努力帮助人们购物并在他们的财务目标方面省钱，而＃34; Muszynski说。 ＆＃34;我认为随着世界正在开放后科迪德，随着公司正在努力扩大和发展，提高这种资本水平提供更快的扩张机会，无论是与人才扩展团队或消费者营销或扩展产品和贷款伙伴。这笔钱只是让你做很多能够在空间中产生很大的影响。＆＃34;
  Muszynski拒绝分享当前收入局的详细信息。然而，该公司确实告诉Crain＆＃39;在12月份，其每月收入在之前的18个月内飙升了2,150％。
 值得注意的是，考虑到在Covid-19大流行期间许多学生贷款的收藏品中的暂停 - 这一想法是，当他们的付款延迟时，更少的人可能会转向再融资，从而降低其潜在的用户市场。 
＆＃34;我们继续看到显着的增长。我认为消费者行为的大规模转变，他们想要购物和拯救他们的家园，＆＃34;他说，参考流行期间加快了数字银行的加速通过。 ＆＃34;我们有一些主要的尾风推动这个行业的前进。＆＃34;
 在其产品上建立，本月飞溅推出了仍在学校的借款人的贷款人网络。 Muszynski表示，该公司计划在未来几个月内推出其他贷款产品。
 这项业务的前景激发了飞溅的投资者和其他人寻找一块学生贷款再融资行业。
 例如，在这个空间中的许多比赛中，克利夫兰＆＃39; S钥匙银行于2019年收购了Laurel Road，这是一家专业从事医疗保健领域的借款人（如医生和牙医）的学生贷款再融资平台。关键从Laurel Road获得了强大的收入，这是斯普勒斯·斯特拉姆之一，而且这个春天将平台扩展到了医疗工作者的数字亲和银行，提供了额外的贷款产品。
 ＆＃34;数字贷款人的重要性和复杂性正在增长Apace，＆＃34; Carti Ventures的Venture主任Charley Howe表示，在一份声明中。 ＆＃34; Splash Financial正在刺激数字转型策略，这将满足消费者的新要求。我们在贷款经验的持续演变中看到了显着的增长潜力，我们很激烈，以支持飞溅和＃39;下一阶段的增长。＆＃34;
 Splash有大约120名员工。大约60％的人在克利夫兰工作，其他人与其他人展开并从该国其他地区远程工作。 Muszynski预计未来12个月的总劳动力加倍。
 这种筹款可能将成为今年在俄亥俄州东北部的最大风险投资之一。 
根据普华永道和CB见解编制的数据，2020年东北俄亥俄州最大的VC协议达到了莱克伍德的3号内，该湖伍德在第三季度筹集了1亿美元。 这个市场的下一个最大的最大后，这是威洛比的神经医疗，第四季度筹集了4280万美元。  去年国家最大的VC交易来自哥伦布＆＃39; 橄榄，在2020年，在三轮上筹集了3825百万美元。
note_en:
Cleveland's  Splash Financial, a digital lending platform specializing in student loan refinancing, has  announced the close of a $44.3 million Series B funding round that will help it further accelerate its steady growth.
 This round of venture capital follows $12.3 million raised in a Series A round in May 2020. The fintech company has raised more than $60 million in equity funding since its founding in 2013. Splash was previously known as GradSchoolLoans until a rebranding in 2016.
 The firm said the Series B round was led by partners of DST Global, Citi Ventures, Detroit Venture Partners and Firebolt Ventures, as well as existing investors CMFG Ventures and Northwestern Mutual Future Ventures.
 Splash founder and CEO Steven Muszynski said the investment will help expand the platform's lending network and automated underwriting platform. Both are critical pillars of the business, which features a hybrid marketplace model whereby users can shop for and compare rates when looking to refinance their loans.
 "I think this shows the confidence our investors have in what we're doing in trying to help people shop and save money when it comes to their financial goals," Muszynski said. "I think as the world is opening up post-COVID, and as companies are trying to expand and grow quickly, raising this level of capital provides greater opportunity for faster expansion, whether that's expanding the team with talent or consumer marketing, or expanding products and lending partners. The money just allows you to do a lot to be able to make a large impact in the space."
  Muszynski declined to share details of the current revenue picture. However, the firm did tell Crain's in December its monthly revenue had  spiked 2,150% over the prior 18 months.
 That's noteworthy considering the pause in collections for many student loans during the COVID-19 pandemic — the idea being that fewer people might turn to refinancing when their payments are delayed, thereby decreasing its potential market of users.
  "We continue to see significant growth. And I think there is a mass shift in consumer behavior where they want to shop and save from their homes," he said, referencing the accelerated adoption of digital banking during the pandemic. "We have some major tailwinds propelling this industry forward."
 Building on its offerings, Splash this month launched a network of lenders for borrowers still in school. Muszynski said the company plans to unveil other lending products in the coming months.
 The outlook for this business excites Splash investors and others looking for a piece of the student loan refinancing industry.
 Among many playing in this space, Cleveland's KeyBank, for instance, in 2019  acquired Laurel Road, a student loan refinancing platform that specializes in borrowers in the health care field (like doctors and dentists). Key has seen strong revenue from Laurel Road, which is one of Splash's many partners, and this spring expanded the platform into a  digital affinity bank for health care workers, offering additional lending products.
 "The importance and sophistication of digital lenders is growing apace," said Charley Howe, director of venture investing at Citi Ventures, in a statement. "Splash Financial is spearheading a digital transformation strategy that will meet the new demands of consumers. We see significant growth potential in the continued evolution of the lending experience, and we are thrilled to support Splash's next phase of growth."
 Splash has about 120 employees. About 60% of those are working out of Cleveland, with others spread out and working remotely from other parts of the country. Muszynski anticipates doubling the total workforce over the next 12 months.
 This fundraise by Splash likely will be among the largest venture capital deals this year in Northeast Ohio.
 According to  data compiled by PwC and CB Insights, the largest VC deal in Northeast Ohio in 2020 went to  Within3 of Lakewood, which raised $100 million in the third quarter. The next largest in this market after that went to  Neuros Medical of Willoughby, which raised $42.8 million in the fourth quarter.
 The largest VC deal in the state last year came with Columbus'  Olive, which raised $382.5 million over three rounds in 2020.
title: Splash Financial，一个专门从事学生贷款再融资的数字贷款平台，由DST全球，花旗企业和更多的B领导44.3M系列B.
title_en: Splash Financial, a digital lending platform specializing in student loan refinancing, raises $44.3M Series B led by DST Global, Citi Ventures, and more
